dict.string: Orbit needs camera access to let you take photos when creating event posts and updating your profile picture. For example, you can capture photos of events you're attending or venues you're visiting to share with friends on the map.

Orbit uses your location to show you nearby events and help friends discover spontaneous activities happening around you. For example, when you create an event, your location helps others find it on the map, and we can notify you when friends are nearby.

Orbit uses your location to show you nearby events and help friends discover spontaneous activities happening around you. For example, when you create an event, your location helps others find it on the map, and we can notify you when friends are nearby.

Orbit uses your location to show you nearby events and help friends discover spontaneous activities happening around you. For example, when you create an event, your location helps others find it on the map, and we can notify you when friends are nearby.

Orbit accesses your photo library to let you select photos when creating event posts or updating your profile. For example, you can choose photos from your library to add to an event you're creating, such as selecting a photo of a concert venue or restaurant.
This app uses notifications to keep you informed.

Orbit accesses your contacts to help you find friends who are already using the app and invite others to join. For example, we match phone numbers and email addresses from your contacts with existing Orbit users so you can quickly connect with friends and see their events on the map.
